tool_description: Maps court hierarchies and jurisdiction relationships to determine precedential authority and appellate pathways within legal systems.

primary_jurisdiction.description: Primary jurisdiction to analyze (federal, state name, or specific court)

comparison_jurisdictions.description: Additional jurisdictions for comparative hierarchy analysis

case_type.description: Type of case for jurisdiction analysis: civil, criminal, administrative, appellate

include_specialized_courts.description: Whether to include specialized courts (tax, bankruptcy, etc.) in hierarchy

error_messages: Invalid primary jurisdiction: Specify a valid U.S. federal or state jurisdiction
Invalid comparison jurisdiction: One or more comparison jurisdictions are not recognized
Invalid case type: Use one of [civil, criminal, administrative, appellate]
Jurisdiction conflict: Cannot compare incompatible jurisdiction types
usage: Provide primary_jurisdiction and optionally comparison_jurisdictions, case_type, and specialized court inclusion. Returns hierarchical relationships and authority mappings.

hierarchy_levels.description: Court levels from lowest to highest authority in primary jurisdiction

appellate_pathways.description: Available appellate routes within the jurisdiction

cross_jurisdiction_authority.description: Authority relationships with comparison jurisdictions if provided

specialized_courts.description: Specialized courts included in analysis if requested

binding_precedent_sources.description: Courts whose decisions are binding in the primary jurisdiction
